criterion: Reward for accurately documenting all patient-expressed symptoms, concerns, and subjective descriptions of pain intensity and variability exactly as stated or clearly implied in the transcript.

Reward for faithfully recording the clinician’s stated assessments and plan elements, including monitoring hydroxychloroquine response, potential dose adjustment or alternative therapy, and confirmation of daily folic acid use.

Reward for including only chart details that are both relevant to the encounter and reflected or alluded to in the dialogue (e.g., RA diagnosis, current medications, sulfa-drug allergy) while omitting unrelated chart data.
Penalize for introducing information, assessments, diagnoses, instructions, or data not present in either the transcript or the relevant portions of the chart (fabrication).
Penalize for any inaccuracy in names, dosages, frequencies, or descriptions of medications or allergies when compared directly with transcript or chart.

Penalize for copying chart information that is irrelevant to this visit (e.g., unrelated historical conditions, empty goal lists) or for misrepresenting chart data (e.g., wrong age or condition code).
